R ‚û°Ô∏è Output to PDF, HTML, etc ## Markdown ``{=html} - Tools and language to add formatting to simple documents - Readable and lightweight - Portable, convenient ## Rmarkdown? ::: columns ::: {.column width="83%"} - File format and package ecosystem to combine ``{=html} markdown-formatted text with R code - Compatible with HTML - Produces an intermediate `.md` file that can be processed to render multiple outputs (PDF, HTML, Word, etc.) ::: ::: {.column width="16%"} ![](https://bookdown.org/yihui/rmarkdown/images/hex-rmarkdown.png) ![](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rstudio/hex-stickers/main/PNG/knitr.png) ::: ::: ## Quarto ::: {style="text-align: right"} ![](https://quarto.org/quarto.png){width="22%"} ::: . . . - Open Source technical and scientific publishing system - The new generation of rmarkdown - Multi-language - Multi-format - Well [documented](https://quarto.org/docs/guide/) ## ![rmarkdown](https://d33wubrfki0l68.cloudfront.net/61d189fd9cdf955058415d3e1b28dd60e1bd7c9b/b739c/lesson-images/rmarkdownflow.png) ![Quarto](https://quarto.org/docs/get-started/hello/images/rstudio-qmd-how-it-works.png) ## What you see is what you get (WYSIWYG) ::: columns ::: {.column width="50%"} ![](imgs/word.JPG){width="650px"} ::: ::: {.column width="50%"} ![](imgs/word.JPG){width="650px"} ::: ::: ## Separate source and output ::: columns ::: {.column width="50%"} ``` --- title: "geom_point demonstration" author: "Luis" format: html: theme: pulse highlight-style: breeze --- ## Scatterplot with `geom_point` Flipper vs. body mass ``` ```` ``` {{r}} #| warning: false library(palmerpenguins) library(ggplot2) ggplot(penguins,aes(flipper_length_mm,body_mass_g))+geom_point() ``` ```` ::: ::: {.column width="50%"} ![](imgs/quartooutputeng.png) ::: ::: ## Dynamic documents Combine text, code, code output, images, and results ![Douglas et al. (2022) - An Introduction to R](https://intro2r.com/images/workflow1.png) ## Output formats
::: {style="font-size: 3em; text-align: center; color: #4194c5"} ``{=html} ``{=html} ``{=html} ``{=html} ``{=html} ``{=html} ``{=html} ::: ::: columns ::: {.column width="50%"} Blogs\ PDF\ Reports\ Manuscripts\ ::: ::: {.column width="50%"} Presentations\ Books\ Courses\ Notebooks ::: ::: ## Do I have Quarto? - Installed automatically with RStudio since version v2022.07 - Install from the official [download page](https://quarto.org/docs/download/) Current version is: v1.5.57 `quarto --version` in your terminal to check for installed version # New Qmd files {background-color="black"} - Create with the 'File' dropdown menu in RStudio - Create with any text editor ## Formatting text Certain charcters take on special meanings in ``{=html} so we use them to define formatting

::: columns ::: {.column width="50%"} \*italic\* and \*\*bold\*\*\ superscript\^2\^\ subscript\~2\ \~\~crossed out\~\~\ \`code\` ::: ::: {.column width="50%"} *italic* and **bold**\ superscript^2^\ subscript~2~\ ~~crosset out~~\ `code` ::: ::: ## Headings Define sections and subsections, and are parsed to create tables of contents +----------------+---------------+ | Markdown | Result | +================+===============+ | ``` | # Level 1 | | # Level 1 | | | ``` | | +----------------+---------------+ | ``` | ## Level 2 | | ## Level 2 | | | ``` | | +----------------+---------------+ | ``` | ### Level 3 | | ### Level 3 | | | ``` | | +----------------+---------------+ | ``` | #### Level 4 | | #### Level 4 | | | ``` | | +----------------+---------------+ ## Images Add from a local path or from the web `![](imgs/Mila.jpeg)` ![](imgs/Mila.jpeg) # Images Label, resize, align `![Mila the dog](imgs/Mila.jpeg){width="30%" fig-align="right"}` ![Mila the dog](imgs/Mila.jpeg){width="30%" fig-align="right"} ## Code #### Code chunks Insert with `ctrl + shift + I` or the ![](imgs/boton.png) button Chunk content will be executed ::: {.cell} ````{.cell-code} ```{{r}} sqrt(64) log(1000) 25*12 ``` ```` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] 8 [1] 6.907755 [1] 300 ``` ::: ::: > The result of the code execution appears in the output We can control if the code is shown, executed, or hidden. ## YAML preamble Contains document metadata to specify: - Visual options to be applied throughout - Author and date information - Output format - `---` befor and after the preamble - Flimsy, be careful with indentations here ## Example 1: Possums report {background-color="black"} - change [theme](https://quarto.org/docs/output-formats/html-themes.html#overview) (`theme`) - change code [highlighting](https://quarto.org/docs/output-formats/html-code.html#highlighting) (`highlight style`) - hide or show [code](https://quarto.org/docs/output-formats/html-code.html#folding-code) (`code-fold`, `code-tools`, `code-summary`) ## Presentations Quarto uses the `reveal.js` framework to create HTML presentations - Includes presenter tools - New slides delimited with `---` or created with level two heading (`##`) ## Example 2: Presentation about pets {background-color="black"} - Gradual [reveal](https://quarto.org/docs/presentations/#incremental-lists) of lists and bullet points - Change slide background `{background-color}` - Export to PDF (`E` key toggles print preview) ## Sharing Quarto documents ### Render and share - as HTML (embed-resources), PDF, PPT, etc. ### Publish on Quartopub 1. Publish from the Quarto command line ### Deploy on GitHub pages, netlify, etc. ## Useful reading resources üìÉ Meghan Hall - [Making Slides in Quarto with reveal.js](https://meghan.rbind.io/blog/quarto-slides/) üìí Thomas Mock - [Getting Started with Quarto](https://rstudio-conf-2022.github.io/get-started-quarto/) # Thanks!

<script>
  // htmlwidgets need to know to resize themselves when slides are shown/hidden.
  // Fire the "slideenter" event (handled by htmlwidgets.js) when the current
  // slide changes (different for each slide format).
  (function () {
    // dispatch for htmlwidgets
    function fireSlideEnter() {
      const event = window.document.createEvent("Event");
      event.initEvent("slideenter", true, true);
      window.document.dispatchEvent(event);
    }

    function fireSlideChanged(previousSlide, currentSlide) {
      fireSlideEnter();

      // dispatch for shiny
      if (window.jQuery) {
        if (previousSlide) {
          window.jQuery(previousSlide).trigger("hidden");
        }
        if (currentSlide) {
          window.jQuery(currentSlide).trigger("shown");
        }
      }
    }

    // hookup for slidy
    if (window.w3c_slidy) {
      window.w3c_slidy.add_observer(function (slide_num) {
        // slide_num starts at position 1
        fireSlideChanged(null, w3c_slidy.slides[slide_num - 1]);
      });
    }

  })();
</script>
